comment.author: 41031254@N02
comment._content: He joined the army under age . Suffered a lot of sickness. Came home but enlisted again, The poor guy was dead by age 18. What a sad story.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
According to CWGC website he was Private 544. Son of Mrs. M. A. Evans, of 13, Tyr Nest, Bonymaen Rd., Swansea.

Public family tree on Ancestry shows he was the son of John and Mary Ann Evans (nee Francis) and was born in Swansea circa 1899. In 1901 the family were living at 8 Owens Row in Swansea where Mr Evans was a Lead Smelter. By 1911 they had moved to another house in the same street at 5 Owen's Row, Kilvey Road, Foxhole, Swansea. Ivor had 3 older brothers and one younger.
